etymology.description: 抹 (to smear; ground/powdered) + 茶 (tea) = powdered tea (matcha).
etymology.interpretation: Loanword from Japanese using Chinese characters, referring to finely ground green tea powder. Highlights the powdered form of tea used for whisking and flavoring.

parts.english: to wipe; to smear; to apply; to erase
tea; tea leaves; tea plant; tea beverage

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝抹茶拿铁(我喜歡喝抹茶拿鐵)。
examples.english: I like to drink matcha lattes.

examples.chinese: 日本的抹茶很有名(日本的抹茶很有名)。
examples.english: Matcha from Japan is very famous.

examples.chinese: 抹茶是用碾磨绿茶做成的(抹茶是用碾磨綠茶做成的)。
examples.pinyin: Mǒchá shì yòng niǎnmó lǜchá zuòchéng de.
examples.english: Matcha is made by grinding green tea into powder.
